t: Psalm 89
Remembering the Covenant with David, and Sorrow for Lost Blessings
A Contemplation of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I*pn will sing of the mercies of the Lord*s forever; With*ld my mouth will I make known Your faithfulness to all generations.
For*ld I have said, “Mercy shall be built up forever; Your*ld faithfulness You shall establish in the very heavens.”
“I*ln have made a covenant with My chosen, I*ld have sworn to My servant David:
‘Your*ld seed I will establish forever, And*ld build up your throne to all generations.’” Selah*ipg
And*pn the heavens will praise Your wonders, O Lord;*s Your*ld faithfulness also in the assembly of the saints.
For*ld who in the heavens can be compared to the Lord?*s Who*ild among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the Lord?*s
God*ld is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, And*ld to be held in reverence by all those*i around Him.
O*ld Lord*s God of hosts, Who*ld is*i mighty like You, O Lord?*s Your*ld faithfulness also surrounds You.
You*ld rule the raging of the sea; When*ld its waves rise, You still them.
You*ld have broken Rahab in pieces, as one who is slain; You*ld have scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.
The*ln heavens are*i Yours, the earth also is*i Yours; The*ld world and all its fullness, You have founded them.
The*ld north and the south, You have created them; Tabor*ld and Hermon rejoice in Your name.
You*ld have a mighty arm; Strong*ld is Your hand, and*i high is Your right hand.
Righteousness*ld and justice are*i the foundation of Your throne; Mercy*ld and truth go before Your face.
Blessed*ld are*i the people who know the joyful sound! They*ld walk, O Lord,*s in the light of Your countenance.
In*ld Your name they rejoice all day long, And*ld in Your righteousness they are exalted.
For*ld You are*i the glory of their strength, And*ld in Your favor our horn is exalted.
For*ld our shield belongs*i to the Lord,*s And*ld our king to the Holy One of Israel.
Then*ln You spoke in a vision to Your holy one, And*ld said: “I have given help to one*i who*i is*i mighty; I*ld have exalted one chosen from the people.
I*ld have found My servant David; With*ld My holy oil I have anointed him,
With*ld whom My hand shall be established; Also*ld My arm shall strengthen him.
The*ld enemy shall not outwit him, Nor*ld the son of wickedness afflict him.
I*ld will beat down his foes before his face, And*ld plague those who hate him.
“But*ln My faithfulness and My mercy shall*i be*i with him, And*ld in My name his horn shall be exalted.
Also*ld I will set his hand over the sea, And*ld his right hand over the rivers.
He*ld shall cry to Me, ‘You are*i my Father, My*ld God, and the rock of my salvation.’
Also*ld I will make him My*i firstborn, The*ld highest of the kings of the earth.
My*ld mercy I will keep for him forever, And*ld My covenant shall stand firm with him.
His*ld seed also I will make to*i endure*i forever, And*ld his throne as the days of heaven.
“If*ln his sons forsake My law And*ld do not walk in My judgments,
If*ld they break My statutes And*ld do not keep My commandments,
Then*ld I will punish their transgression with the rod, And*ld their iniquity with stripes.
Nevertheless*ld My lovingkindness I will not utterly take from him, Nor*ld allow My faithfulness to fail.
My*ld covenant I will not break, Nor*ld alter the word that has gone out of My lips.
Once*ld I have sworn by My holiness; I*ld will not lie to David:
His*ld seed shall endure forever, And*ld his throne as the sun before Me;
It*ld shall be established forever like the moon, Even*ld like*i the faithful witness in the sky.” Selah*ipg
But*pn You have cast off and abhorred, You*ld have been furious with Your anointed.
You*ld have renounced the covenant of Your servant; You*ld have profaned his crown by*i casting*i it*i to the ground.
You*ld have broken down all his hedges; You*ld have brought his strongholds to ruin.
All*ld who pass by the way plunder him; He*ld is a reproach to his neighbors.
You*ld have exalted the right hand of his adversaries; You*ld have made all his enemies rejoice.
You*ld have also turned back the edge of his sword, And*ld have not sustained him in the battle.
You*ld have made his glory cease, And*ld cast his throne down to the ground.
The*ld days of his youth You have shortened; You*ld have covered him with shame. Selah*ipg
How*pn long, Lord?*s Will*ld You hide Yourself forever? Will*ld Your wrath burn like fire?
Remember*ld how short my time is; For*ld what futility have You created all the children of men?
What*ld man can live and not see death? Can*ld he deliver his life from the power of the grave? Selah*ipg
Lord,*pn where are*i Your former lovingkindnesses, Which*ild You swore to David in Your truth?
Remember,*ld Lord, the reproach of Your servants— How*ild I bear in my bosom the*i reproach*i of*i all the many peoples,
With*ld which Your enemies have reproached, O Lord,*s With*ld which they have reproached the footsteps of Your anointed.
Blessed*ln be*i the Lord*s forevermore! Amen*ld and Amen.
